title: Gorge's Edge & Tears of Taroko
subTitle: 峽谷邊緣與月牙之淚：震後地質見證
intro: Witness the scars and resilience of nature post-earthquake. Visit the safest high-ground viewpoint at Buluowan and listen to the singing stones of Qixingtan.
transportation: Take **Taiwan Tourist Shuttle 310** from Hualien Station + Local Taxi.

spots.name: Taroko Visitor Center & Shakadang (太魯閣遊客中心)
spots.description: Although deep canyon access is limited, the center offers the best geological education. Check if the Shakadang Trail's first section is open for a safe walk.

spots.name: Buluowan Suspension Bridge (布洛灣山月吊橋)
spots.description: The safest high-angle viewpoint post-quake. Overlook the majestic Liwu River valley from this high-tech, quake-resistant bridge.

spots.name: Qixingtan & 48 Highlands (七星潭 & 四八高地)
spots.description: Listen to the 'singing' of rolling pebbles (swimming is prohibited). Walk up to the 48 Highlands for a panoramic view of the crescent bay.

spots.name: Dongdamen Night Market (東大門夜市)
spots.description: A carnival of flavors. Must-try: 'Lin's Grilled Corn' and indigenous spice-infused 'Maqaw Pork Buns'.

title: Emerald Lake & Forest Bath
subTitle: 縱谷綠寶石：鯉魚潭舒活
intro: The most stable inland attraction post-quake. Enjoy SUP on the barrier lake and explore the history of the forestry industry.

spots.name: Liyu Lake (鯉魚潭)
spots.description: Hualien's largest inland lake. Perfect for SUP or pedal boats. The circular trail is flat and family-friendly.

spots.name: Chinan National Forest Recreation Area (池南國家森林遊樂區)
spots.description: A former forestry transit station displaying old steam locomotives and logging machinery from the Halun Mountain Railway era.

spots.name: Hualien Cultural & Creative Industries Park (花蓮文創園區)
spots.description: A renovated old winery in the city center. A quiet space featuring Japanese-style wooden architecture.

title: Pacific Geological Poetry
subTitle: 太平洋的地質詩篇：台11線海岸冒險
intro: Explore the front line of tectonic plate collision. From glass swings to sea caves, witness the dramatic sculptures of the Pacific Ocean.

spots.name: Qinbuzhizi Skywalk (親不知子天空步道)
spots.description: Walk on a glass path built into the vertical cliff face, suspended above the crashing waves of the Pacific.

spots.name: Shimen March Cave (石門麻糬洞)
spots.description: A sea erosion cave shaped like a 'March' car. Also a filming location for Martin Scorsese's movie 'Silence'.

spots.name: Shitiping (石梯坪)
spots.description: A world-class geological classroom featuring white volcanic tuff and unique 'cuesta' (single-slope hill) landforms.

title: Wood Aroma & Sugar Sweetness
subTitle: 木香與糖味：縱谷人文歷史慢旅
intro: Travel back to the era of 'Little Shanghai' logging towns and sugar empires. End the trip with a unique golden hot spring experience.

spots.name: Lintianshan Forestry Culture Park (林田山林業文化園區)
spots.description: Once the fourth largest logging farm in Taiwan, known as 'Little Shanghai'. The preserved cypress buildings and Zhongshan Hall are stunning.

spots.name: Hualien Sugar Factory (花蓮觀光糖廠)
spots.description: Stay overnight in a Japanese-style wooden cabin. Don't miss the ice cream and feeding fish in the morning.

spots.name: Ruisui Hot Spring (瑞穗溫泉)
spots.description: Experience the 'Golden Soup', Taiwan's only carbonate hot spring rich in iron, which turns yellow upon oxidation.

title: Hunters & Extreme Streams
subTitle: 山海獵人與極限溪流：深度冒險
intro: Move from gazing to participating. Learn Indigenous survival skills, trace the emerald streams, and kayak at sunrise under the cliffs.

spots.name: Malasang Hunter School (馬拉桑獵人學校)
spots.description: Wear traditional attire, learn archery, set traps, and make bamboo rice. Understand the Amis wisdom of ecological balance.

spots.name: River Tracing (溯溪體驗)
spots.description: Hualien's ace activity. Jump into emerald pools and climb waterfalls under professional guidance.

spots.name: Qingshui Cliff Kayaking/SUP (清水斷崖獨木舟)
spots.description: Paddle out at sunrise to look back at the majestic cliffs dropping vertically into the Pacific. The safest way to view the cliffs post-quake.

title: Call of the Deep Valley
subTitle: 縱谷深處的呼喚：瓦拉米與稻浪
intro: A journey to the southernmost part of Hualien. Walk the historic Walami Trail and drive along the scenic County Road 193.

spots.name: Walami Trail (瓦拉米步道)
spots.description: Part of the historic Batongguan Traversing Trail. A 5-star ecological trail with suspension bridges and waterfalls, home to the Formosan Black Bear.

spots.name: Yuli Township (玉里鎮)
spots.description: Visit the junction of the Eurasian and Philippine Sea Plates. Must eat: Yuli Noodles and Yuli Stinky Tofu.

spots.name: County Road 193 (193縣道)
spots.description: The most beautiful country road in Taiwan, running parallel to Hwy 9 but offering quieter, stunning views of paddy fields and tribal villages.
